com.mob41.hkoweather.api

Class HKO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mob41.hkoweather.api.HKO
  • Deprecated. 

    The code is unusable if the RSS feed changed the indexes of the
    table columns.

    Instead, you are recommended to use a WeatherManager to get the weather: 
     WeatherManager man = new WeatherManager("HKO");
 man.fetchWeatherReport();
 WeatherReport report = man.getWeatherReport();
 System.out.println(report.getTemp());
 

    public class HKO
extends java.lang.Object

    Hong Kong Observatory Weather RSS Feed API for Java


    HKO doesn't have a open-source API for its weather report. (Except the paid-service of the XML weather system)
    This is a API for Java Developers in Hong Kong to get weather reports of HKO.
    This API depends on:
    ROME v1.0, JSoup v1.8.3, JDOM v1.1.3
    Author:
    Anthony Law (mob41)

    • Method Detail

      • getRSS

        public static com.sun.syndication.feed.synd.SyndFeed getRSS()
                                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                            com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException,
                                                            java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        The code is unusable if the RSS feed changed the indexes of the
        table columns.

        Instead, you are recommended to use a WeatherManager to get the weather: 
         WeatherManager man = new WeatherManager("HKO");
 man.fetchWeatherReport();
 WeatherReport report = man.getWeatherReport();
 System.out.println(report.getTemp());
        To get RSS feed from Hong Kong Observatory RSS Feed Weather Report. In SyndFeed Type, provided by ROME.
        Returns:
        Returns a SyndFeed of HKO Weather RSS feed. If the RSS server is down or no connection, the function will return null;
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Wrong XML Format Wrong XML Format
        com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException - Could not connect to RSS feed, Wrong RSS Feed Format. Could not connect to RSS feed, Wrong RSS Feed Format.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Wrong RSS Feed Format. Wrong RSS Feed Format.

      • getWeatherImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getWeatherImage()
                                                    throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                                           java.io.IOException,
                                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                           com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException
        Deprecated. 
        The code is unusable if the RSS feed changed the indexes of the
        table columns.

        Instead, you are recommended to use a WeatherManager to get the weather: 
         WeatherManager man = new WeatherManager("HKO");
 man.fetchWeatherReport();
 WeatherReport report = man.getWeatherReport();
 System.out.println(report.getTemp());
        Get the hourly weather status image from the RSS Feed Weather Report.

        You don't need to use getRSS() again as this function reads the readings of RSS itself.
        If it received null from the getTempDescription(), it returns null, to prevent NullPointerException.

        Returns:
        BufferedImage: The Weather status image from the RSS Feed Weather Report.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Wrong XML Format Wrong XML Format
        java.net.MalformedURLException - The target RSS Feed URL format is wrong
        com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException - Could not connect to RSS feed, Wrong RSS Feed Format. Could not connect to RSS feed, Wrong RSS Feed Format.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Wrong RSS Feed Format. Wrong RSS Feed Format.

      • getTemp

        public static int getTemp(int locationState)
                   throws java.text.ParseException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        The code is unusable if the RSS feed changed the indexes of the
        table columns.

        Instead, you are recommended to use a WeatherManager to get the weather: 
         WeatherManager man = new WeatherManager("HKO");
 man.fetchWeatherReport();
 WeatherReport report = man.getWeatherReport();
 System.out.println(report.getTemp());
        Get the Temperature from the RSS Feed Weather Report.
        Parameters:
        locationState - it is the number of a specific table object in the RSS report. The number cannot be 0. Or a IndexOutOfBounds Exception will happen. locationState represents a place which is monitored of its weather by HKO. The locationState should only ranging to 1 - 26.
        Returns:
        The temperature from the RSS feed weather report. It returns 5000 (Impossible outdoor temperature) to tell there is a error, no connection, etc...
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - The string (Table Column that includes the temperature and the text) doesn't have any integer.
        java.io.IOException - Wrong XML Format
        com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException - Could not connect to RSS feed, Wrong RSS Feed Format.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Wrong RSS Feed Format.

      • getRSSEntries

        public static java.util.List<com.sun.syndication.feed.synd.SyndEntryImpl> getRSSEntries()
                                                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                                        com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException,
                                                                                        java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        The code is unusable if the RSS feed changed the indexes of the
        table columns.

        Instead, you are recommended to use a WeatherManager to get the weather: 
         WeatherManager man = new WeatherManager("HKO");
 man.fetchWeatherReport();
 WeatherReport report = man.getWeatherReport();
 System.out.println(report.getTemp());
        Get RSS Entries from the HKO Weather RSS Feed. It is a API function for developers. It actually
        does nothing.
        Returns:
        List: Returns a list of SyndEntryImpl (Feed Entries) It returns null if RSS feed is null (No Connection, error etc...)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Wrong XML Format
        com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException - Could not connect to RSS feed, Wrong RSS Feed Format.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Wrong RSS Feed Format.

      • getTempDescription

        public static org.jsoup.nodes.Document getTempDescription()
                                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                          com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException,
                                                          java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        The code is unusable if the RSS feed changed the indexes of the
        table columns.

        Instead, you are recommended to use a WeatherManager to get the weather: 
         WeatherManager man = new WeatherManager("HKO");
 man.fetchWeatherReport();
 WeatherReport report = man.getWeatherReport();
 System.out.println(report.getTemp());
        Get HKO Temperature RSS Description (HTML Table Code)

        It is a API function for developers. It actually
        does nothing.

        Returns:
        Document: Returns a document with HKO Temperature Data parsed by Jsoup. It returns null if RSS entries are null (No Connection, error etc...)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Wrong XML Format
        com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException - Could not connect to RSS feed, Wrong RSS Feed Format.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Wrong RSS Feed Format.

      • getTempTable

        public static org.jsoup.nodes.Element getTempTable()
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException,
                                                   java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        The code is unusable if the RSS feed changed the indexes of the
        table columns.

        Instead, you are recommended to use a WeatherManager to get the weather: 
         WeatherManager man = new WeatherManager("HKO");
 man.fetchWeatherReport();
 WeatherReport report = man.getWeatherReport();
 System.out.println(report.getTemp());
        Get the table element from the HKO Temperature Data of the document parsed by Jsoup.
        The collection of the table element is done using Jsoup.

        It is a API function for developers. It actually
        does nothing.

        Returns:
        The Table Element with the Temperature Data. It returns null if the Temperature Data RSS Description is null. (No Connection, Not parsable, etc.)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Wrong XML Format
        com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException - Could not connect to RSS feed, Wrong RSS Feed Format.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Wrong RSS Feed Format.

      • getTempTableCol

        public static java.util.Iterator<org.jsoup.nodes.Element> getTempTableCol()
                                                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                          com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException,
                                                                          java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        The code is unusable if the RSS feed changed the indexes of the
        table columns.

        Instead, you are recommended to use a WeatherManager to get the weather: 
         WeatherManager man = new WeatherManager("HKO");
 man.fetchWeatherReport();
 WeatherReport report = man.getWeatherReport();
 System.out.println(report.getTemp());
        Get the Iterator of Element from the Temperature Data Table

        It is a API function for developers. It actually
        does nothing.

        Returns:
        Return a iterator of all the columns of the table. (Jsoup call it elements) It returns null if the table is null. (No connection, error, not parsable, etc..)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Wrong XML Format
        com.sun.syndication.io.FeedException - Could not connect to RSS feed, Wrong RSS Feed Format.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Wrong RSS Feed Format.
